_comment: This file shows a complete span log entry with inline documentation
_purpose: Use this as a reference when implementing structured logging in your Lambda/services
_span_id_note: Unique identifier for this span. Generate with UUID or nanoid.
_parent_span_id_note: ID of the calling span. Null for root spans (entry points).
_component_note: Type of service/component. Values: lambda, sqs, bedrock_agent, bedrock_model, dynamodb, http_client, etc.
_operation_note: The specific operation performed. Examples: Invoke, SendMessage, GetItem, InvokeAgent, InvokeModel
_ts_start_note: ISO 8601 timestamp when operation started. Include milliseconds for precision.
_ts_end_note: ISO 8601 timestamp when operation completed. Used to calculate duration.
_attempt_note: Retry attempt number. 1 = first try, 2+ = retries after failure.
_itk_trace_id_note: Custom trace ID passed through your system for end-to-end correlation.
_lambda_request_id_note: AWS Lambda request ID from context.aws_request_id. Essential for CloudWatch correlation.
_xray_trace_id_note: AWS X-Ray trace ID if X-Ray tracing is enabled.
_sqs_message_id_note: SQS message ID when processing queue messages.
_bedrock_session_id_note: Bedrock agent session ID for multi-turn conversations.

request.inputText: What is the status of ticket ABC-123?

_request_note: Input payload sent to the operation. Redact sensitive fields before logging.

response.completion: Ticket ABC-123 is currently in 'In Progress' status.

_response_note: Output received from the operation. Redact PII and sensitive data.
_error_note: Error object if the operation failed. Example: {"code": "ThrottlingException", "message": "Rate exceeded"}
